basic.floral_language:
Hedera canariensis
Floriography: tenacious, vigorous, young
Hedera canariensis is a genus of 12–15 species of evergreen climbing or ground-creeping woody plants in the family Araliaceae, have aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrition from the air. Beautiful symmetric leaves. Can be placed in the living room, on desks, or for hanging in pots. 
Hedera canariensis tolerates shade, suitable under scattered light in summer and 3-4 hours sunlight in winter. Blooms sometimes in September to November with pale yellow or green flowers.
basic.blooming: Foliage plants, sometimes flowers in September-November, light yellow or light green flowers

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Resistant to shade plant, put in places with scattered light in summer, in winter may take 3-4h sunlight
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, rub leaves with water in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly in the growing season, stop in winter
